index_struct.text: The build_package.yml workflow sets up Python 3.9, installs dependencies, uses the package, and runs an import. The lint.yml workflow sets up Python 3.9, installs dependencies, and runs the linter. The unit_test.yml workflow sets up Python 3.9 and 3.8, installs dependencies, and runs the tests.

0.text:
name: Build Package

# Build package on its own without additional pip install

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main
  pull_request:

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
    strategy:
      # You can use PyPy versions in python-version.
      # For example, pypy-2.7 and pypy-3.8
      matrix:
        os: [ubuntu-latest, windows-latest]
        python-version: ["3.9"]
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - name: Set up Python ${{ matrix.python-version }}
        uses: actions/setup-python@v4
        with:
          python-version: ${{ matrix.python-version }}
      - name: Install deps
        run: |

1.text:
deps
        run: |
          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
          python -m pip install wheel setuptools
          python setup.py sdist bdist_wheel
      - name: Use package
        run: |
          cd dist
          python -m pip install --find-links=. gpt-index
      - name: Run import
        run: |
          python -c "import gpt_index"

2.text:
name: Linting

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main
  pull_request:

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    strategy:
      # You can use PyPy versions in python-version.
      # For example, pypy-2.7 and pypy-3.8
      matrix:
        python-version: ["3.9"]
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - name: Set up Python ${{ matrix.python-version }}
        uses: actions/setup-python@v4
        with:
          python-version: ${{ matrix.python-version }}
      - name: Install deps
        run: |
          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
          pip install -r requirements.txt

3.text:
pip install -r requirements.txt
          pip install -r data_requirements.txt
      - name: Run linter
        run: make lint

4.text:
name: Unit Testing

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main
  pull_request:

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    strategy:
      # You can use PyPy versions in python-version.
      # For example, pypy-2.7 and pypy-3.8
      matrix:
        python-version: ["3.9", "3.8"]
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - name: Set up Python ${{ matrix.python-version }}
        uses: actions/setup-python@v4
        with:
          python-version: ${{ matrix.python-version }}
      - name: Install deps
        run: |
          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
          pip install

5.text:
pip
          pip install -r requirements.txt
          pip install -r data_requirements.txt
      - name: Run testing
        run: pytest tests

6.text: This code file contains three separate GitHub workflows, each with their own purpose. The first workflow, build_package.yml, is used to build a package without additional pip install. It sets up Python 3.9, installs dependencies, uses the package, and runs an import. The second workflow, lint.yml, is used to lint the code. It sets up Python 3.9, installs dependencies, and runs the linter. The third workflow, unit_test.yml, is used to run unit tests. It sets up Python 3.9 and 3.8, installs dependencies, and runs the tests.

It sets up Python 3.9, installs dependencies, uses the package, and runs an import. The second workflow, lint.yml, is used to lint the code. It sets up Python 3.9, installs dependencies, and runs the linter. The third workflow, unit_test.yml, is used to run unit tests. It sets up Python 3.9 and 3.8, installs dependencies, and runs the tests.

62c3c1b509dc1615c7ce16a8de81a41731e19b5b.text:
name: Build Package

# Build package on its own without additional pip install

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main
  pull_request:

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
    strategy:
      # You can use PyPy versions in python-version.
      # For example, pypy-2.7 and pypy-3.8
      matrix:
        os: [ubuntu-latest, windows-latest]
        python-version: ["3.9"]
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - name: Set up Python ${{ matrix.python-version }}
        uses: actions/setup-python@v4
        with:
          python-version: ${{ matrix.python-version }}
      - name: Install deps
        run: |
          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
          python -m pip install wheel setuptools
          python setup.py sdist bdist_wheel
      - name: Use package
        run: |
          cd dist
          python -m pip install --find-links=. gpt-index
      - name: Run import
        run: |
          python -c "import gpt_index"

name: Linting

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main
  pull_request:

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    strategy:
      # You can use PyPy versions in python-version.
      # For example, pypy-2.7 and pypy-3.8
      matrix:
        python-version: ["3.9"]
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - name: Set up Python ${{ matrix.python-version }}
        uses: actions/setup-python@v4
        with:
          python-version: ${{ matrix.python-version }}
      - name: Install deps
        run: |
          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
          pip install -r requirements.txt
          pip install -r data_requirements.txt
      - name: Run linter
        run: make lint

name: Unit Testing

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main
  pull_request:

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    strategy:
      # You can use PyPy versions in python-version.
      # For example, pypy-2.7 and pypy-3.8
      matrix:
        python-version: ["3.9", "3.8"]
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - name: Set up Python ${{ matrix.python-version }}
        uses: actions/setup-python@v4
        with:
          python-version: ${{ matrix.python-version }}
      - name: Install deps
        run: |
          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
          pip install -r requirements.txt
          pip install -r data_requirements.txt
      - name: Run testing
        run: pytest tests

It sets up Python 3.9, installs dependencies, uses the package, and runs an import. The second workflow, lint.yml, is used to lint the code. It sets up Python 3.9, installs dependencies, and runs the linter. The third workflow, unit_test.yml, is used to run unit tests. It sets up Python 3.9 and 3.8, installs dependencies, and runs the tests.
